item.description:
Every year, Criterion Cinema's in New Haven puts on a selection of the SHORT Films nominated for the Oscar Awards.

I (A.J.) Plan to go to Tuesday Night's 6:50 showing of the Shorts in the Live Action Category.  Everyone is in charge of getting their own ticket.

I will plan to get to the lobby by 6:30 to meet/greet and if anyone wants to chill before hand.  I'll move into the theater at about 6:45. (Unless there appears to be a stampede in which case earlier.)

If you miss us in the lobby, I will keep my phone (315-345-9348) on until they dim the lights, but after that you're on your own.

These are SHORT films, not full length features, they're each in the 10-25 minute range. (So 5 of them add up to your normal full length feature time).

Again, I'm seeing the "Live Action" category on this evening, so be sure you get the right one as there is also a set of Animated and Documentaries.

If you have a Criterion Club Card you can also take advantage of Super Tuesday which offers $6 tickets and $5 Tubs of Popcorn!  (You need to sign up for that days ahead of time though if you haven't already.)

If people wish to socialize about the films afterwards and it's early enough, we can go next door to Kelly's after.  (Time dependent, it is a work night.)

Some thing to keep in mind: Everyone's got to start some where, and many great directors have had shorts nominated before they were famous for full length films.

Parking: Temple Street Garage is directly across the street, and Criterion offers a discount on parking there (I do not know how much).  Alternatively there is a lot of Metered parking on Temple and the surrounding streets.
item.how_to_find_us: Look at Kelly's before hand or wait in the Lobby till 7:05. If you miss us you can try to call AJ before the lights Dim: 315-345-9348.
